intro: Crotalaria karongensis, commonly known as the Karongensis spurred crownflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and compound leaves. Its flowers are yellow with prominent violet markings, and it produces elongated pods containing kidney-shaped seeds. Crotalaria karongensis is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in nitrogen fixation due to its symbiotic relationship with rhizobia.
